result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marco Antonio Martinez-Sandoval
parties.address: 8664 S Highland Road, Fish Creek, WI 54212

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Commit no further criminal acts during the period of this agreement. Have no contact with ANM, dob 10/14/91, her family, residence or workplace. Defendant understands that "no contact" means no direct or indirect contact, whether in person, by phone, or by mail, of by any electronic means, and whether initiated by the defendant or by someone on the defendant's behalf.

Take any/all medicines prescribed to the defendant by a licensed physician. Defendant shall comply with any and all rules of probation, satisfy all conditions of supervision and successfully complete any term of probation ordered as a part of this case. Defendant shall provide a copy of this agreement, along with the Criminal Complaint, to any counselor and sign any and all releases necessary to allow the counselor (or agency) to report compliance or lack thereof to the District Attorney's Office.  Any assessments done without this agreement and the Criminal Complaint(s) being supplied to the counselor will be considered violations of this agreement and not be accepted.  This agreement may be revoked or the defendant may have to complete a new assessment.

Pay costs on each count of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No contact direct or indirect with A.N.M., her family, her residence, her workplace.

Submit DNA sample. Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Follow any and all doctor's recommendations, including taking all prescribed medications.

records.addlTxt: Per Connie, apply $1,000 cash bond to financial obligations owing.   IF DEFENDANT IS PICKED UP ON WARRANT, COURT WILL NEED TO SET NEW BOND.

02:45 PM Defendant Marco Antonio Martinez-Sandoval not in court.  Andrew Peter Naze appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises of Defendant's failure to appear for deferred hearing, requests statewide warrant. Court questions whether conditions have been met. State presents argument. Court questions date of sentencing hearing, orders statewide bench warrant.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on November 18, 2019 at 02:45 pm.
Oath and Consent to Serve as Special Prosecutor

Defendant Marco Antonio Martinez-Sandoval not in court. Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Atty Nordin advises that she represented Defendant, cannot proceed as prosecutor. Atty Grode believes a motion to revoke will have to be filed, requests status conference, believes another agency will have to take case. Court will accept oral motion to revoke.
on Pet for judgment for unpaid fine/forf/other

records.descr: Pet for judgment for unpaid fine/forf/other
Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Plea Hearing held 8/27/15
Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement
for DNA sample

Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1-6. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas on Counts 2-6, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 2-6. Court finds basis to accept plea on Count 1, withholds acceptance of plea on Count 1, reviews conditions contained within DAGPA, accepts agreement. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. State advises that deportation will not serve as basis for revocation of DAGPA. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations.
Defense waives reading of Information, advises that Defendant is prepared to proceed with plea.

Defendant Marco Antonio Martinez-Sandoval in court with attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Reme Bashi appeared as interpreter, sworn. Discussion regarding how case will be proceeding. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial. State files Information adding 3 charges, provides factual basis of additional charges for probable cause purposes. Court questions Defense, who agrees with factual basis. Court finds probable cause to support new charges.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 10, 2018 at 10:00 am.
by Defendant
Interpreter Reme Bashi confirmed her availability for 8/27 hearing.

Defendant Marco Antonio Martinez-Sandoval in court with attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Reme Bashi appeared as interpreter, sworn. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews previous activity, charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Bond continues as is.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Application, Affidavit, Return, Acknowledgement of Return of Officer
Defendant was fingerprinted on 7/16/15.
by Rosa Sandoval
No contact direct or indirect with ANM, dob 10/14/91. Take medications as prescribed by treating medical professionals. Follow all treatment recommendations.

Defendant Marco Antonio Martinez-Sandoval in court with attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin. Defendant Marco Antonio Martinez-Sandoval in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. John Vaughn appeared as interpreter by phone, sworn. Defense advises of meeting with Defendant this morning, reviewed letter from his uncle and Human Services. Court questions Defense on competency concerns. Defense has no concerns at this point. Court advises of contact with jail over weekend. Discussion regarding medications. Bond set. Return 7/27/15, 10:00.

Defendant Marco Antonio Martinez-Sandoval appeared by video. Attorney Scott L. Stebbins appeared by phone. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Reme Bashi appeared as interpreter by phone, sworn. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, questions Atty Stebbins regarding competency. Atty Stebbins did not believe competency was an issue, but conversation with Defendant was short and there was language barrier. Court questions uncle, who confirms need for interpreter. Atty Stebbins thinks Defendant speaks limited English, is covering for Atty Gerbers. Court has competency concerns, denies bond. Bond hearing adjourned to Monday at 10:00. Court orders Defendant to take all prescribed medications, jail to try to make sure he has those medications available on Monday.
from Defendant's uncle and Human Services
